meanings.sent1: The spilled oil was tainting the clear water in the lake.
meanings.sent2: The rotten food was tainting the fresh groceries in the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was tainting the picnic by sneaking into the food.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments were tainting her positive outlook on life.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist was tainting the blank wall with colorful designs.

meanings.definition: Spoiling the purity or quality of something
meanings.sent1: The dishonest actions were tainting the reputation of the company.
meanings.sent2: The mold was tainting the taste of the bread.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter was tainting the elegant dinner party with his spills.
meanings.sent4: The lies were tainting the trust between friends.
meanings.sent5: The storm was tainting the peaceful atmosphere with loud thunder.
